summary:
• A potential "housing revolution" could transform Canadian cities.
• Two articles discuss this possibility.
• Serial killer Robert Pickton died in prison.

• A Chinese spacecraft has successfully landed on the far side of the moon.
• The mission aims to collect rare lunar samples from the unexplored region known as the "dark" side of the moon.
• This achievement marks a significant milestone in China's ambitious space exploration program.

• Kylian Mbappé signs with Real Madrid
• A significant transfer between European football clubs

• A police officer was stabbed in Mannheim.
• The officer later died from their injuries.
• This incident occurred on an unspecified date.

• An Icelandic volcano has erupted, producing mesmerizing lava rivers.
• The eruption is causing widespread damage to the surrounding area.
• The exact location of the eruption has not been disclosed by authorities.

• India's general elections saw arrests and allegations surrounding the process.
• The country held the largest democratic event in the world.
• Reports emerged of electoral irregularities despite the conclusion of voting.

• The US expects Israel to accept a Gaza ceasefire plan if Hamas agrees.
• Biden's ceasefire plan increases pressure on Netanyahu within Israel.
• Israeli reservists question their role after fighting in Gaza.

• Gay conversion therapy is being practiced in Italy.
• Many people have undergone this therapy, which aims to change their sexual orientation.
• Participants describe it as the "darkest period" of their lives.

• Mexico holds historic presidential election, with a strong possibility of electing its first female president.
• The election marks a significant milestone in Mexican politics.
• Three main candidates are vying for the top spot: Andrés Manuel López Obrador, Ricardo Anaya, and José Antonio Meade.

• South Africa's president faces a challenging period due to a disappointing electoral performance.
• The African National Congress (ANC) must reassess its strategy after receiving a low vote count in recent elections.
• The party needs to revamp its approach to regain voter trust and secure better outcomes in future polls.

• At least seven people have been killed in Sri Lanka due to monsoon floods.
• Heavy rainfall has caused widespread flooding across the country.
• The exact number of fatalities may increase as rescue efforts continue.

• Zelensky accuses Russia and China of undermining the summit.
• Ukrainian military commanders criticize basic training as inadequate.
• Russian and Chinese interference hampers peace efforts in Ukraine.

• Media tycoon Rupert Murdoch has married for the fifth time.
• This is his fourth marriage since he lost his previous wife in 2016.
• His new wife, Ann Lesley Sharp, is an English actress.

• Donald Trump says hush-money trial is "very hard" on his wife Melania.
• One person was killed and many others were injured in an Ohio mass shooting.
• The United States has proposed a ceasefire plan for the conflict in Gaza.
